greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pisano period of n^2 divided by Pisano period of n.
comment: Conjecture (Saha & Karthik): a(n) = 1 only for n = 1, 6, and 12.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Arpan Saha and C. S. Karthik, A few equivalences of Wall-Sun-Sun prime conjecture, arXiv:1102.1636 [math.NT], 2011.
mathematica: pp[1] = 1; pp[n_] := For[k = 1, True, k++, If[Mod[Fibonacci[k], n] == 0 && Mod[Fibonacci[k+1], n] == 1, Return[k]]];
results.author: _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 13 2014
